title: Matrix Exchange Format to ESet | Creating a single-cell RNA-seq reference dataset for deconvolution
questions: Where can I find good quality scRNA-seq reference datasets?
How can I reformat and manipulate these downloads to create the right format for MuSiC?
objectives: You will retrieve raw data from the EMBL-EBI Single cell expression atlas.
You will manipulate the metadata and matrix files.
You will combine the metadata and matrix files into an ESet object for MuSiC deconvolution.
You will create multiple ESet objects - both combined and separated out by disease phenotype for your single cell reference.
key_points: The EMBL-EBI Single-cell expression atlas contains high quality datasets.
Metadata manipulation is key for generating the correctly formatted resource.

outputs.annotation: Experimental designs often include extra stuff (likely the barcodes not meeting the EBI pre-processing criteria), so this way we streamline down to only those barcodes in the barcodes file.
outputs.name: Join two Datasets
